LinkIdTextCardinalityTypeDescription & Constraints
HIV.C.PrEPVisitTODO: description goes hereQuestionnairehttp://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/Questionnaire/HIV.C.PrEPVisit#0.3.0
1Client's reason for the prevention visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de1#Observation.value[x]
2Client is visiting for the recommended 3-month pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de7#Observation.value[x]
3The client is currently taking PrEP. Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) of HIV is the use of ARV drugs by people who are not infected with HIV to block the acquisition of HIV.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de10#Observation.value[x]
4Way in which pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is taken (daily or event-driven)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de11#Observation.value[x]
5Other PrEP dosing type (specify)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de14#Observation.value[x]
6HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de16#Observation.value[x]
7The client's history in taking PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de21#Observation.value[x]
8The date on which the client started or restarted pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de24#Observation.value[x]
9Client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de25#Observation.value[x]
10Date client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de26#Observation.value[x]
11The client's history in taking post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for HIV prevention0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de27#Observation.value[x]
12Dates when the client previously used post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de30#Observation.value[x]
13Signs the client is at a substantial risk of HIV infection0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de31#Observation.value[x]
14Client's intention or desire in the next year to either become pregnant or prevent a future pregnancy0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de36#Observation.value[x]
15Symptoms that could suggest an acute HIV infection0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de41#Observation.value[x]
16Treatment adherence of client's sex partner for partners that are HIV positive0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de50#Observation.value[x]
17The client is eligible for PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de56#Observation.value[x]
18After being evaluated as eligible for PrEP, the client was offered PrEP0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de57#Observation.value[x]
19Listing of tests for clients on or starting pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) that may be recommended or should be considered0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de58#Observation.value[x]
20Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de66#Observation.value[x]
21Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min).0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de67#Observation.value[x]
22Backbone regimen for post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for adults and adolescents0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de68#Observation.value[x]
23Third-drug for use in post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) regimen in adults and adolescents0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de71#Observation.value[x]
24Backbone regimen for post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for children. A backbone regimen is a combination of two nucleos(t)ide reverse-transcriptase inhibitor antiretroviral (ARV) activity against HIV when combined with a third ARV drug.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de77#Observation.value[x]
25Estimated creatinine clearance of the client returned from lab in mL/min0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de88#Observation.value[x]
26Value used for gender for calculating creatinine clearance if required. For transgender populations, the sex at birth is used in the Cockcroft-Gault equation if the person is not using hormone therapy; among transgender populations using hormone therapy for more than three months, the current gender can be used.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de89#Observation.value[x]
27If the laboratory does not have the capacity to estimate creatinine clearance, the provider can use the Cockcroft–Gault equation to calculate estimated creatinine clearance based on measured serum creatinine, the client’s sex at birth, age and estimated lean body weight.0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de92#Observation.value[x]
28Date when the specimen was collected0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de93#Observation.value[x]
29Listing of contraindications to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de94#Observation.value[x]
30Reason why a substitution was made in the pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de101#Observation.value[x]
31Client was prescribed pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) on a first visit0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de107#Observation.value[x]
32Days of medication client has been prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de108#Observation.value[x]
33HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen prescribed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de109#Observation.value[x]
34Whether adherence counselling was provided0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de110#Observation.value[x]
35Number of condoms given to the client, if any were distributed0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de122#Observation.value[x]
36Whether any HIV self-test kits were given to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de123#Observation.value[x]
37Number of HIV self-test kits distributed to the client0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de124#Observation.value[x]
38Whom the client plans to give the HIV self-test kit (self, sexual partner, social contact, etc.)0..1stringDefinition: http://fhir.org/guides/itech-uw/StructureDefinition/hiv-c-de125#Observation.value[x]

Documentation for this format

item.text: Client's reason for the prevention visit
Client is visiting for the recommended 3-month pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) visit
The client is currently taking PrEP. Oral pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) of HIV is the use of ARV drugs by people who are not infected with HIV to block the acquisition of HIV.
Way in which pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is taken (daily or event-driven)
Other PrEP dosing type (specify)
HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen
The client's history in taking PrEP
The date on which the client started or restarted pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Date client stopped taking pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
The client's history in taking post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for HIV prevention
Dates when the client previously used post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP)
Signs the client is at a substantial risk of HIV infection
Client's intention or desire in the next year to either become pregnant or prevent a future pregnancy
Symptoms that could suggest an acute HIV infection
Treatment adherence of client's sex partner for partners that are HIV positive
The client is eligible for PrEP
After being evaluated as eligible for PrEP, the client was offered PrEP
Listing of tests for clients on or starting pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) that may be recommended or should be considered
Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min)
Test serum creatinine to identify pre-existing renal disease (estimated creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min).
Backbone regimen for post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for adults and adolescents
Third-drug for use in post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) regimen in adults and adolescents

Backbone regimen for post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for children. A backbone regimen is a combination of two nucleos(t)ide reverse-transcriptase inhibitor antiretroviral (ARV) activity against HIV when combined with a third ARV drug.
Estimated creatinine clearance of the client returned from lab in mL/min

Value used for gender for calculating creatinine clearance if required. For transgender populations, the sex at birth is used in the Cockcroft-Gault equation if the person is not using hormone therapy; among transgender populations using hormone therapy for more than three months, the current gender can be used.

If the laboratory does not have the capacity to estimate creatinine clearance, the provider can use the Cockcroft–Gault equation to calculate estimated creatinine clearance based on measured serum creatinine, the client’s sex at birth, age and estimated lean body weight.
Date when the specimen was collected
Listing of contraindications to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP)
Reason why a substitution was made in the pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen
Client was prescribed pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) on a first visit
Days of medication client has been prescribed
HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) regimen prescribed
Whether adherence counselling was provided
Number of condoms given to the client, if any were distributed
Whether any HIV self-test kits were given to the client
Number of HIV self-test kits distributed to the client
Whom the client plans to give the HIV self-test kit (self, sexual partner, social contact, etc.)
